revised_title: Observations of Nebulae and Clusters of Stars: A Review of John Herschel's Work
tldr: John Herschel's observations of nebulae and star clusters made with a 20-foot reflector between 1825 and 1833 provide valuable insights into the nature and distribution of these celestial objects. His work expanded upon his father's previous observations and contributed to the understanding of the mysterious and diverse nature of nebulae and clusters visible in the northern hemisphere.
